blocks.name: df-phi
blocks.content: Define the Euler phi function (also called "Euler totient function"), which counts the number of integers less than ` n ` and coprime to it, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 25. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: phival
blocks.content: Value of the Euler ` phi ` function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm phival(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wceq(cfv(cphi, c0), cfv(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cn, cphi, cfv(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cfv(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat1))))
  fveq2d(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat1)), crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabeqbidv(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cv(hs0)), co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat1), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c0, nat1, cfz)
  eqeq1d(co(cv(s0), cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat1, co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cgcd)
  df-phi(hs0, s0)
  fvex(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(chash, crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1))))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, cv(hs0))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, c0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm phival(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℕ →(φ ` c0)=(# ` { s0 ∈(1[...]c0)|(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cn, cphi, (# ` { s0 ∈(1[...]c0)|(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }), (# ` { s0 ∈(1[...]hs0)|(s0[gcd]hs0)= 1 }))
  fveq2d(chash, { s0 ∈(1[...]hs0)|(s0[gcd]hs0)= 1 }, { s0 ∈(1[...]c0)|(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }, hs0 = c0)
  rabeqbidv(s0, (1[...]hs0), (1[...]c0), hs0 = c0, (s0[gcd]hs0)= 1, (s0[gcd]c0)= 1)
  oveq2(hs0, c0, nat1, cfz)
  eqeq1d((s0[gcd]hs0), nat1, (s0[gcd]c0), hs0 = c0)
  oveq2(hs0, c0, s0, cgcd)
  df-phi(hs0, s0)
  fvex(chash, { s0 ∈(1[...]c0)|(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 })
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.c((# ` { s0 ∈(1[...]c0)|(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }))
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, hs0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, c0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: phicl2
blocks.content: Bounds and closure for the value of the Euler ` phi ` function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)

thm phicl2(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(cphi, c0), co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
} = {

  phival(hs0, c0)
  mpbir3and(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cz), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, c0))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cz))
  nn0zi(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))))
  ax-mp(wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cn0), wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn))
  hashcl(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  syl5eqbrr(nat1, cle, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cfv(chash, csn(nat1)), wcel(c0, cn))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(chash, csn(nat1)), nat1), wcel(nat1, cz))
  hashsng(nat1, cz)
  sylibr(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(cfv(chash, csn(nat1)), cle, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wbr(csn(nat1), cdom, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))))
  mpsyl(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(csn(nat1), cdom, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), universe), wss(csn(nat1), crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))))
  rabex(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))
  snssd(nat1, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), wcel(c0, cn))
  elrabd(hs0, nat1, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wcel(c0, cn), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1), wceq(co(nat1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  eqeq1d(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1, co(nat1, cgcd, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), nat1))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), nat1, cgcd, c0)
  eleq2s(c0, cn, cfv(cuz, nat1), wcel(nat1, co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  eluzfz1(c0, nat1)
  nnuz()
  syl(wcel(c0, cn), wceq(co(nat1, cgcd, c0), nat1), wcel(c0, cz))
  1gcd(c0)
  ssdomg(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), universe, csn(nat1))
  mp2an(wb(wbr(cfv(chash, csn(nat1)), cle, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wbr(csn(nat1), cdom, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wcel(csn(nat1), cfn), wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn))
  snfi(nat1)
  hashdom(csn(nat1), crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn)
  syl5breq(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, c0, cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wcel(c0, cn))
  mpbir(wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  mp2(wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), universe), wss(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  ovex(nat1, cfz, c0)
  ssdomg(co(nat1, cfz, c0), universe, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  mp2an(wb(wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn))
  mp2an(wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn), wss(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  ssrab2(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))
  ssfi(co(nat1, cfz, c0), crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  fzfi(nat1, c0)
  hashdom(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn)
  syl(wcel(c0, cn), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, c0)), c0), wcel(c0, cn0))
  nnnn0(c0)
  hashfz1(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), w3a(wcel(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cz), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, c0))), wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  1z()
  nnz(c0)
  elfz1(nat1, c0, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(nat1, cfz, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(nat1)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(co(nat1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
}

blocks.content: Lemma for ~ phibnd . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)

thm phibndlem(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wss(crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylibr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wss(crab(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wi(wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))))
  ralrimiva(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wi(wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))))
  necon4bd(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
  syld(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wn(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wne(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wi(wn(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c0, cn))
  ord(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0))), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  biimpa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wo(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  eleq2s(c0, cn, cfv(cuz, nat1), wb(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wo(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  fzm1(c0, nat1, cv(s0))
  nnuz()
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, c0)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wne(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wne(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1), wne(co(c0, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  eqnetrd(co(c0, cgcd, c0), nat1, c0, wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  eqtrd(co(c0, cgcd, c0), c0, cfv(cabs, c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c0), cfv(cabs, c0)), wcel(c0, cz))
  eluzelz(c0, nat2)
  gcdid(c0)
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wcel(c0, cn))
  eluz2nn(c0)
  absidd(c0, wcel(c0, cn))
  nnre(c0)
  nn0ge0d(c0, wcel(c0, cn))
  nnnn0(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(nat1, cr), wbr(nat1, clt, c0))
  1re()
  eluz2gt1(c0)
  ltne(nat1, c0)
  neeq1d(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1, co(c0, cgcd, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(s0), c0, cgcd, c0)
  rabss(s0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cgcd, c0), nat1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfv(cuz, nat2))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cuz, nat2)
  diff.cuz.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)

blocks.name: phibnd
blocks.content: A slightly tighter bound on the value of the Euler ` phi ` function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm phibnd(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wbr(cfv(cphi, c0), cle, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))
} = {
  3brtr4d(cfv(cphi, c0), cle, co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  sylibr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
  mpsyl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfn), wss(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))))
  phibndlem(hs0, c0)
  ssdomg(co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfn, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  mp2an(wb(wbr(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))), cle, cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wbr(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cdom, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)))), wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfn))
  mp2an(wcel(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn), wss(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  fzfi(nat1, c0)
  ssrab2(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1))
  ssfi(co(nat1, cfz, c0), crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  fzfi(nat1, co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  hashdom(crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)), co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), cfn)
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wceq(cfv(cphi, c0), cfv(chash, crab(hs0, co(nat1, cfz, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cgcd, c0), nat1)))), wcel(c0, cn))
  phival(hs0, c0)
  eqcomd(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  3syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), co(c0, cmin, nat1)), wcel(c0, cn), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cn0))
  eluz2nn(c0)
  nnm1nn0(c0)
  hashfz1(co(c0, cmin, nat1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(nat1, cfz, c0))
}

blocks.name: dfphi2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the Euler ` phi ` function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)

blocks.name: hashdvds
blocks.content: The number of numbers in a given residue class in a finite set of integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jun-2016.)

blocks.name: phiprm
blocks.content: Value of the Euler ` phi ` function at a prime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm phiprm(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(cfv(cphi, c0), co(c0, cmin, nat1)))
} = {
  3eqtr3d(cfv(cphi, c0), co(c0, cmin, nat1), cfv(cphi, co(c0, cexp, nat1)), co(co(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), cmul, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), wcel(c0, cprime))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(cfv(cphi, co(c0, cexp, nat1)), co(co(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), cmul, co(c0, cmin, nat1))), wcel(nat1, cn))
  1nn()
  phiprmpw(c0, nat1)
  fveq2d(cphi, co(c0, cexp, nat1), c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  exp1d(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  eqtrd(co(co(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), cmul, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), co(c0, cmin, nat1), co(nat1, cmul, co(c0, cmin, nat1)), wcel(c0, cprime))
  oveq1d(co(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), cmul, co(c0, cmin, nat1), nat1, wcel(c0, cprime))
  syl5eq(co(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1)), nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat0), wcel(c0, cprime))
  oveq2i(c0, cexp, co(nat1, cmin, nat1), nat0)
  1m1e0()
  exp0d(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  mulid2d(co(c0, cmin, nat1), wcel(c0, cprime))
  sylancl(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(co(c0, cmin, nat1), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(nat1, cc))
  zcnd(c0, wcel(c0, cprime))
  prmz(c0)
  ax-1cn()
  subcl(c0, nat1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm phiprm(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Prime →(φ ` c0)=(c0[-]1))
} = {
  3eqtr3d((φ ` c0), (c0[-]1), (φ `(c0[^]1)), ((c0[^](1[-]1))[×](c0[-]1)), c0 ∈ Prime)
  mpan2(c0 ∈ Prime, (φ `(c0[^]1))=((c0[^](1[-]1))[×](c0[-]1)), 1 ∈ ℕ)
  1nn()
  phiprmpw(c0, nat1)
  fveq2d(cphi, (c0[^]1), c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  exp1d(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  eqtrd(((c0[^](1[-]1))[×](c0[-]1)), (c0[-]1), (1[×](c0[-]1)), c0 ∈ Prime)
  oveq1d((c0[^](1[-]1)), cmul, (c0[-]1), nat1, c0 ∈ Prime)
  syl5eq((c0[^](1[-]1)), nat1, (c0[^]0), c0 ∈ Prime)
  oveq2i(c0, cexp, (1[-]1), nat0)
  1m1e0()
  exp0d(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  mulid2d((c0[-]1), c0 ∈ Prime)
  sylancl(c0 ∈ Prime, (c0[-]1)∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ ℂ, 1 ∈ ℂ)
  zcnd(c0, c0 ∈ Prime)
  prmz(c0)
  ax-1cn()
  subcl(c0, nat1)
}

blocks.name: crth
blocks.content: The Chinese Remainder Theorem: the function that maps ` x ` to its remainder classes ` mod M ` and ` mod N ` is 1-1 and onto when ` M ` and ` N ` are coprime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)

blocks.name: phimul
blocks.content: The Euler ` phi ` function is a multiplicative function, meaning that it distributes over multiplication at relatively prime arguments. Theorem 2.5(c) in [ApostolNT] p. 28. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm phimul(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(cfv(cphi, co(c0, cmul, c1)), co(cfv(cphi, c0), cmul, cfv(cphi, c1))))
} = {
  phimullem(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), cxp(co(nat0, cfzo, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), cop(co(cv(hs0), cmo, c0), co(cv(hs0), cmo, c1))), crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, c0), nat1)), crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, c1), nat1)), crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, co(c0, cmul, c1)), nat1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  eqid(co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)))
  eqid(cxp(co(nat0, cfzo, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, c1)))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), cop(co(cv(hs0), cmo, c0), co(cv(hs0), cmo, c1))))
  id(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  eqid(crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, c0), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  eqid(crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  eqid(crab(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cgcd, co(c0, cmul, c1)), nat1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(cxp(co(nat0, cfzo, c0), co(nat0, cfzo, c1)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)))
  diff.hs1.c(cmpt(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, co(c0, cmul, c1)), cop(co(cv(hs0), cmo, c0), co(cv(hs0), cmo, c1))))
  diff.hs0.w(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  diff.hs1.w(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
}

thm eulerthlem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))

  -| wi(w0, wf1o(c5, c1, c2))

  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2)), wceq(c1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cphi, c3))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2)), diffsc(s0, c0))

blocks.name: eulerth
blocks.content: Euler's theorem, a generalization of Fermat's little theorem. If ` A ` and ` N ` are coprime, then ` A ^ phi ( N ) == 1 ` (mod ` N ` ). This is Metamath 100 proof #10. Also called Euler-Fermat theorem, see theorem 5.17 in [ApostolNT] p. 113. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fermltl
blocks.content: Fermat's little theorem. When ` P ` is prime, ` A ^ P == A ` (mod ` P ` ) for any ` A ` , see theorem 5.19 in [ApostolNT] p. 114. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 19-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: prmdiveq
blocks.content: The modular inverse of ` A mod P ` is unique. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: odzval
blocks.content: Value of the order function. This is a function of functions; the inner argument selects the base (i.e., mod ` N ` for some ` N ` , often prime) and the outer argument selects the integer or equivalence class (if you want to think about it that way) from the integers mod ` N ` . In order to ensure the supremum is well-defined, we only define the expression when ` A ` and ` N ` are coprime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.) (Revised by AV, 26-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm odzval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wceq(cfv(cfv(codz, c0), c1), cinf(crab(s0, cn, wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cexp, cv(s0)), cmin, nat1))), cr, clt)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {

thm odzval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

  ⊣ d(s0, c0)

} = {
  3impb(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℤ, (c1[gcd]c0)= 1, ((odZ ` c0)` c1)= inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((c1[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <))

  fveq1d((odZ ` c0), c1, (hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 } ↦ inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <)), c0 ∈ ℕ)
  fvmpt(hs1, c0, cn, codz, (hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 } ↦ inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <)), (hs0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[gcd]hs1)= 1 } ↦ inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | hs1[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <)))
  mpteq12dv(hs0, { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[gcd]hs1)= 1 }, inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | hs1[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <), { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }, inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <), hs1 = c0)
  syl6eqr({ hs0 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[gcd]hs1)= 1 }, { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 }, { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(hs0[gcd]c0)= 1 }, hs1 = c0)
  rabbidv(hs0, cz, hs1 = c0, (hs0[gcd]hs1)= 1, (hs0[gcd]c0)= 1)
  eqeq1d((hs0[gcd]hs1), nat1, (hs0[gcd]c0), hs1 = c0)
  oveq2(hs1, c0, hs0, cgcd)
  cbvrabv(s0, hs0, cz, (s0[gcd]c0)= 1, (hs0[gcd]c0)= 1)
  eqeq1d((s0[gcd]c0), nat1, (hs0[gcd]c0), s0 = hs0)
  oveq1(s0, hs0, cgcd, c0)
  infeq1d({ s0 ∈ ℕ | hs1[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, cr, clt, { s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, hs1 = c0)
  rabbidv(s0, cn, hs1 = c0, hs1[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1), c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1))
  breq1(hs1, c0, cdvds, ((hs0[^]s0)[-]1))
  df-odz(hs1, hs0, s0)
  mptrabex(hs0, s0, cz, inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <), (s0[gcd]c0)= 1)
  zex()
  sylbir((c1 ∈ ℤ ∧(c1[gcd]c0)= 1), ((hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 } ↦ inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((hs0[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <))` c1)= inf({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((c1[^]s0)[-]1)}, ℝ, <), c1 ∈ { s0 ∈ ℤ |(s0[gcd]c0)= 1 })
  elrab(s0, c1, cz, (s0[gcd]c0)= 1, (c1[gcd]c0)= 1)
  eqeq1d((s0[gcd]c0), nat1, (c1[gcd]c0), s0 = c1)

  infex({ s0 ∈ ℕ | c0[||]((c1[^]s0)[-]1)}, cr, clt)
  ltso()
  diff.hs1.c(c0)

  diff.co.s(s0, hs0, cgcd, c0)

blocks.name: odzcllem
blocks.content: - Lemma for ~ odzcl , showing existence of a recurrent point for the exponential. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 26-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: odzcl
blocks.content: The order of a group element is an integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: odzid
blocks.content: Any element raised to the power of its order is ` 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.)

blocks.name: odzdvds
blocks.content: The only powers of ` A ` that are congruent to ` 1 ` are the multiples of the order of ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 26-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: odzphi
blocks.content: The order of any group element is a divisor of the Euler ` phi ` function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm odzphi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wbr(cfv(cfv(codz, c0), c1), cdvds, cfv(cphi, c0)))
} = {
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wbr(cfv(cfv(codz, c0), c1), cdvds, cfv(cphi, c0)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmin, nat1)))
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmo, c0), co(nat1, cmo, c0)))
  eulerth(c0, c1)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wb(wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmo, c0), co(nat1, cmo, c0)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmin, nat1))), wcel(c0, cn), wcel(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cz), wcel(nat1, cz))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wcel(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(cfv(cphi, c0), cn0))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  zexpcl(c1, cfv(cphi, c0))
  1zzd(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  moddvds(c0, co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), nat1)
  mpdan(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wb(wbr(c0, cdvds, co(co(c1, cexp, cfv(cphi, c0)), cmin, nat1)), wbr(cfv(cfv(codz, c0), c1), cdvds, cfv(cphi, c0))), wcel(cfv(cphi, c0), cn0))
  nnnn0d(cfv(cphi, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  phicld(c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  odzdvds(c0, c1, cfv(cphi, c0))
}
